Authors: Pedro Pablo Parra, Mary Catherine Aime
Title:
New species of Bannoa described from the tropics and the
first report of the genus in South America
Keywords:
New species of Bannoa described from the tropics and the
first report of the genus in South America
Abstract:
The genus Bannoa consists of four described species: B.
bischofiae, B. hahajimensis, B. ogasawarensis and B. syzygii which have
been found associated with dead leaves in islands in southwestern Japan.
In this study, we describe three new species: Bannoa guamensis, B.
lentae and B. tropicalis from 13 collections made during 2012 and 2013
on the south pacific island of Guam and in Guyana, South America.
Isolates were obtained from the surface of diseased and healthy leaves
of plants in the Euphorbiaceae, Asteraceae and Poaceae. For phylogenetic
analysis, sequences of the nuc rDNA ITS1‐5.8S‐ITS2 (ITS barcode), D1D2
domains of the nuc 28S rDNA (28S), nuc 18S rDNA (18S) and the
Translation elongation factor alpha (TEF1α) regions were amplified.
Intercompatibility tests were performed and subsequent development of
clamp connections and basidia were documented. Evidence for life history
strategies and association with diseased leaves including rust-infected
leaves, are evaluated across the genus. Finally, we document the first
isolate of a member of Bannoa from South America.
